clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Hoarding Behaviour and Eating Disorders Among Holocaust Survivors and Their Descendants
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Hoarding Behaviour and Eating Disorders Among Holocaust Survivors and Their Descendants

brief_summary.textblock: "Hoarding "is a common behavior among Holocaust survivors and is related to the traumatic events they have experienced, and we assume that storage behavior and eating disorders are related to future generations of Holocaust survivors.

primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire that will follow behaviour over generations

arm_group.description: At least 200 Jewish Holocaust survivors of the first generation living in Germany and Israel - an equal number in each country
The second generation, whose parents lived in Europe during the Second World War, now live in Germany (originating from Western and Eastern Europe) - at least 200 participants.

Third generation of Jewish Holocaust survivors who participated in the first phase, currently living in Germany and Israel - at least 200 participants including at least 100 subjects in each country. These are adults only. The research program does not include children and adolescents

study_pop.textblock: Jewish Holocaust survivors living in Germany and Israel Their direct offspring and their children (second and third generation)
